The claim made by Texas Gov: Rick Perry that "every engine manufacturer in the United States is now in the state of Texas" was initially questioned and investigated.
Perry: s office clarified that he was referring only to Caterpillar, a heavy equipment manufacturer that consolidated its engine work in Texas in 2008.
The Texas Department of Economic Develop: which identified three engine makers in Texas: Caterpillar, AER Manufacturing, and Toshiba. A fourth company, Hilite, makes engine components in Texas.
The U: S. Census Bureau's survey of County Business Patterns for 2011 showed that there are 386 engine manufacturers nationwide, but only 17 in Texas. This suggests that there are many more engine makers in the country than in Texas.
